title: Unable to create typeface for univers-45-light font
body:
**Description**

I tried to create font face by passing the fontfamily name "Univers 45 Light" but skiasharp is creating some other typeface instead of "Univers 45 Light".

**Code**

SKTypeface typeface = SKTypeface.FromFamilyName("Univers 45 Light", SKTypefaceStyle.Normal)

**Expected Behavior**

Typeface should be created for "Univers 45 Light".

**Actual Behavior**

Typeface should be created for "Segoe UI".

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  1.59.3
- IDE:  Visual Studio

Additional Info.

I compared the behavior of GetFontFamilies() API in the SKFontManager with the FontFamily.Families property in GDI+.

Please find the fonts list returned by both GDI+ and SkiaSharp in same machine.
[Skia_getfonts.txt](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/files/2768577/Skia_getfonts.txt)
[GDI_getfonts.txt](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/files/2768578/GDI_getfonts.txt)

On further analyzing I found that "Univers 45 Light" is available as "Univers 45".  

Is there a way to get typeface by passing "Univers 45 Light" just like GDI+?

Font installed in system.
[univers-45-light.zip](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/files/2768575/univers-45-light.zip)

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Ah, this issue. It is almost certainly this one: https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/issues/682

You can get the light font by requesting it explicitly:

```csharp
var typeface = SKTypeface.FromFamilyName(
    "Univers 45", SKFontStyleWeight.Light, SKFontStyleWidth.Normal, SKFontStyleSlant.Upright);
```

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/skiasharp.sktypeface.fromfamilyname?view=skiasharp-1.59.3#SkiaSharp_SKTypeface_FromFamilyName_System_String_SkiaSharp_SKFontStyleWeight_SkiaSharp_SKFontStyleWidth_SkiaSharp_SKFontStyleSlant_

I am going to close this one as a duplicate, but feel free to re-open if this doesn't solve your issue.

comments.author: VijayRM
comments.body:
The provided solution not working for **TraditionSansXLight** font. Please find the example code.

`SKTypeface.FromFamilyName("TraditionSansX", SKFontStyleWeight.Light, SKFontStyleWidth.Normal, SKFontStyleSlant.Upright); //Not working.`

The above code creates the typeface for "Segoe UI", whereas if we specify the full name of the font then the type face created as expected.

`SKTypeface.FromFamilyName("TraditionSansXLight", SKFontStyleWeight.Light, SKFontStyleWidth.Normal, SKFontStyleSlant.Upright); // Working`

Could you please provide your suggestions ?

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: Your font has the name TraditionSansXLight so this is expected. The above issue was related to automatically resolving the font weight by name. Like `FontName Light` or `FontName Bold`.

comments.author: VijayRM
comments.body:
Then why can't we use below method for "Univers 45 Light" font?

`SKTypeface.FromFamilyName("Univers 45 Light", SKFontStyleWeight.Light, SKFontStyleWidth.Normal, SKFontStyleSlant.Upright);`

We need a common solution for these fonts. Which approach is best to create type face for following fonts.

- Univers 45 Light
- TraditionSansXLight

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: That font's family name is "Univers 45" and you want to use the light variant. Just call SKTypeFace.FromFamilyName("Univers 45", SKFontStyleWeight.Light, SKFontStyleWidth.Normal, SKFontStyleSlant.Upright)

comments.author: VijayRM
selvarathinamm
comments.body: Instead of replacing "Light" try replacing " Light". This might be a better solution.
